urls.title: The Pangburn Hangout
urls.description: This is where the Pangburn Community hangs out. Travis Pangburn is a Philosopher, Artist and Producer that is best known for producing some of the largest-scale intellectual discussions in history. Most notably, the Sam Harris vs Jordan Peterson series. This discussion Community was born out of this work. We discuss philosophy, art, science & life. The show hosts are seasoned Pangburn veterans that bring their own conversational flavor to the table. All ideas are welcome. Let art & science inspire. Channel Rules 1) No continued bad-faith discourse. This includes interruption, anger, yelling, trolling, passive aggressiveness, advertising, attacking the person and not the argument, lying, scheming to harm the channel, crying "bad-faith" when it isn't etc. 2) No continued unhelpfulness. "Get out of here." "You're not wanted." "We don't like those ideas here." Interrogations of individuals lives will not be allowed. Ideological repetition: It is helpful to avoid repeating ideas that have a

urls.title: Pleasure And Pain: Study Shows Brain's 'Pleasure Chemical' Is Involved In Response To Pain Too
urls.description: For years, the brain chemical dopamine has been thought of as the brain's "pleasure chemical," and studies have linked the addictive properties of drugs like cocaine to their effects on the dopamine system. But now, a new study adds a new twist to dopamine's fun-loving reputation: pain.

I’ve admired and defended @elonmusk for many years. I drive a Tesla (my 2nd). I thought he was a uniter: someone working on the global problems all face. To see him become so small - so desperate for the approval of conspiracy theorists, extremists + hate-mongers - is truly sad.
@ThePangburn Compliance 🤷
The abusive lockdowns were never about covid.

@elonmusk Alyssa Milano traded in her Tesla for a VW… the Hodge morons spitefully replied to her tweet and you responded to their reply with a lol emoji. 

Is that your idea of a civil debate?

Just a note to encourage people of different political or other views to engage in civil debate on Twitter. 

Worst case, the other side has a slightly better understanding of your views.
The “died suddenly” shockumentary is ridiculous disinformation. Let me count the ways…./1
